Theorom - 2 :- 

-> The number of vertices
 of odd degree in a graph is
 always even.

Proof:- 
-> By the first theorem if G is
 a graph with n vertices
 and e edges then,

 ∑_(i=1)^n deg(Vi)=2*e=even
 number 

-> The quantity in the left
 side of above equation
 can be expressed as the
 sum of even degree
 vertices and odd degree
 vertices as follow

∑(i=1)^n deg(Vi) =∑even 
 deg(Vi)
 +
 ∑odd
 deg(Vi)

-> Since the left hand side
 of the above equation
 is even by (1) and the first
 expression on the right
 hand side is also even
 as sum of even numbers
 is even. so second
 expression must be even.

∑_odd deg(Vi)=even number

-> In equation above
 equation deg(Vi) is odd so
 that the total number of
 the terms in the sum must
 be even to make a sum an
 even number.

-> Therefore the number of
 vertices of odd degree in
 a graph is always even.
